Sequence Information.Peptide Name: ARin-s (Arenicin-1 analog, Arg-rich, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: local amino acid shuffling, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (65.22%) toArenicin-1R: 29%, V: 24%, Y: 14%, C=W: 10%.Activity: active against Gram- E.coli ML35p or ATCC 25922 or M15 (MIC 4-8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 or clinical c.i. (MIC 4->16 uM), A. baumanii c.i.  (MIC 16 uM), Gram+ L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus 710A or ATCC 25923 or MRSA ATCC 33591 or clinical c.i. (MIC 16->16 uM), S-intermidius (MIC >16 uM). This symmetry related changes made the peptide less potent.
Literature Information.Author: Orlov DS, Shamova OV, Eliseev IE, Zharkova MS, Chakchir OB, Antcheva N, Zachariev S, Panteleev PV, Kokryakov VN, Ovchinnikova TV, Tossi A.2019
Literature Information.Title: Redesigning Arenicin-1, an Antimicrobial Peptide from the Marine Polychaeta Arenicola marina, by Strand Rearrangement or Branching, Substitution of Specific Residues, and Backbone Linearization or Cyclization.
